items.title: tmux-plugins: Add sessionx

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from https://repology.org/project/tmux-sessionizer/versions.

meta.description for tmux-sessionizer is: Fastest way to manage projects as tmux sessions

meta.homepage for tmux-sessionizer is: https://github.com/jrmoulton/tmux-sessionizer

Updates performed
  • Rust version update
To inspect upstream changes
  • Compare changes on GitHub
Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 0.4.3 with grep in /nix/store/q8jn6n4m65m147aqha0c2ldcrgbrpns8-tmux-sessionizer-0.4.3
  • found 0.4.3 in filename of file in /nix/store/q8jn6n4m65m147aqha0c2ldcrgbrpns8-tmux-sessionizer-0.4.3
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
2 total rebuild path(s)

2 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath

tmux-sessionizer
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/q8jn6n4m65m147aqha0c2ldcrgbrpns8-tmux-sessionizer-0.4.3 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A tmux-sessionizer https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/bc13187ee12e2eb138df5b7917a10560df32ac6a.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/bc13187ee12e2eb138df5b7917a10560df32ac6a#tmux-sessionizer

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/q8jn6n4m65m147aqha0c2ldcrgbrpns8-tmux-sessionizer-0.4.3
ls -la /nix/store/q8jn6n4m65m147aqha0c2ldcrgbrpns8-tmux-sessionizer-0.4.3/bin

items.title: fzf: patch shebang in fzf-tmux

items.content_html:
Description of changes

  • Adds tmux-window-name tmux plugin to tmuxPlugins.
  • This plugin automatically renames windows based on the active windows active process and/or current working directory.
  • This plugin requires interacting with the python libtmux, whose path is hardcoded into the shipped python scripts. So I did a few sed replacements in the postInstall step to patch for NixOS.
    • First, the entry file runs python3 -m pip list to check whether libtmux is available. This is handled by the wrapped script and its python env
    • Then, since its point is to check the running process and modify tmux window names to the respective applications, it required changes of the path it checks for the binaries, for example, to $HOME/.nix-profile/bin/* in a few places.
    • It does a good bit of regex replacement to get the active program, active path, etc. so those needed patching as well

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
